subject: Relationships
title: Humor: The Secret Glue of Friendship
description: A short lesson to help you apply Humor: The Secret Glue of Friendship.

hook.text: People who laugh together stay friends longer. Shared humor is the strongest predictor of lasting friendship.

buildup.text: Laughter releases endorphins and creates a sense of safety. Inside jokes become emotional shorthand for trust.

discovery.text: Studies show pairs who find the same things funny rate their friendship 60% higher than those who don't.

twist.text: It's not about being funny. It's about finding the same things funny. Shared humor means shared worldview.

climax.text: Humor isn't entertainment â€” it's a bonding mechanism. Every inside joke is a tiny commitment to the friendship.

punchline.text: Inside jokes aren't silly. They're the strongest bonds in friendship.

quiz.question: Why is shared humor important in friendship?
options: It signals shared worldview and releases bonding chemicals
